title: Clubs now live for OCE
body:
Hi all,

In the [6.5 patch notes](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-65-notes), we announced that clubs would be going live during the patch cycle.  Well that time is here and clubs are now enabled for Oceania!

> Access clubs by clicking the "Clubs" button, which replaced the "chat room" button in the social panel

Cheers!
Mindstar

replies.body: The [Clubs Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207994746-Guide-to-Clubs) doesn't say anything about character limits or regulations to names and tags. Any idea what they are, who to ask, or if the guide can be updated for that?

Hi, there! Sorry we don't have more details listed - I will ping the owner of that page, but in the meanwhile:

* Club names have a character limit of 25, and can include apostrophes
* Tags are limited to 5 characters, and can include punctuation
* In order to set a tag, your club must have at least 5 members in it
* Club names and tags have the same restrictions as summoner names - no offensive words, "Riot", etc.
* Pro Team names have been reserved and so will also be restricted except for those teams
* Once a club name/tag is set, it cannot be changed without contacting Player Support

Hope this helps!
Saw a club with the tag "OSAMA" today -_-

BUG: Can't remove a "null" summoner's name.

Shows on the sidebar as "**SummonerName"
When clicking revoke invite, a popup appears "Are you sure you wish to remove null from the club <Club Name>?"
Clicking Yes, an event appears "null is not a member of the club <Club Name> and cannot be removed.

Probable cause: Summoner name has "in" somewhere in their username. ("asdjkfginerf", "Test in" etc.)

Temporary fix to remove the null summoner names: Leave the club (as I was the owner and only member of it)

Thanks for reporting this! Can you give us more details as to how you were able to invite? We do have some reports of inviting players who transfer to other regions resulting in this bug as well so any information to help us pinpoint what is causing this would be appreciated. :3

My club's tag doesn't appear next to my name anywhere even though it is set as my active club and the club has over the minimum required number of players in it. In fact, all the other players in the club have it show up next to their names. Any clarification on why this might be happening? 

Cheers.

I dont know who to ask but
if someone leaves from my group and i dont have 5 members
will the tag be lost

The club will keep the tag. However in the future we may move towards having checks in place so that if a club has fewer than 5 players for some amount of time, they become inactive and can lose that tag (similar to the way Ranked Teams worked).
Alright, thanks for clearing that up^^

Hey! Could you please add a feature in the future where you can add people to the club without having them added ? 
I'm part of uni club called Curtin League of Legends Society and makes it hard having to add everyone that has joined our uni club. So some way I can just input their ign into the club ingame and it sends them and invite to join the ingame club.
There's a little empty square box next to the club name in the persistent chat room. What is this for?

You can use that box to set that particular club to active, which puts the tag by your name and makes it show up on your profile, in game, and in postgame lobby.

Cheers
Mindstar
